New Zealand Herald https://www.nzherald.co.nz New Zealand Herald News Feed 2024 年 2 月 23 日星期五 04:09:53 +0000 zh 1每小时1
Northwestern Motorway SH16 temporarily closed: Food truck rolls, spills cooking oil, petrol https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/northwestern-motorway-close-food-truck-rolls-spills-cooking-oil-petrol/RX46YR2TKBGJ3E6DWQJXSURBHU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/northwestern-motorway-close-food-truck-rolls-spills-cooking-oil-petrol/RX46YR2TKBGJ3E6DWQJXSURBHU/ The motorway had closed between Wellesley St and Grafton Rd, and is now open. Fri, 23 Feb 2024 04:08:39 +0000 Auckland traffic is backed up after a food truck rolled on the Northwestern Motorway (SH16). Photo / via Waka Kotahi NZTA
Police arrest two men after service station robberies in Huntly, Waikatohttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-arrest-two-men-after-service-station-robberies-in-huntly-waikato/QCNHZC3FZJDX7EM3RQ65IJ43PE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-arrest-two-men-after-service-station-robberies-in-huntly-waikato/QCNHZC3FZJDX7EM3RQ65IJ43PE/ The offenders allegedly broke into two service stations within one minute. Fri, 23 Feb 2024 04:05:38 +0000 Police in the Waikato town of Huntly arrested two people after robberies at two petrol stations overnight.
Brothers Falala and Valiami Iongi sentenced for murder of Auckland grandmother Meliame Fisi’ihoi https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/brothers-falala-and-valiami-iongi-sentenced-for-murder-of-auckland-grandmother-meliame-fisiihoi/4VZU7SSNJFDVRGT7P34TUK5YEY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/brothers-falala-and-valiami-iongi-sentenced-for-murder-of-auckland-grandmother-meliame-fisiihoi/4VZU7SSNJFDVRGT7P34TUK5YEY/ Craig KapitanThe bullet was intended for the victim's son. Fri, 23 Feb 2024 03:52:43 +0000 Meliame Fisi'ihoi was killed in her South Auckland home in 2020. Brothers Falala and Valiami Iongi were found guilty of murder while cousin Manu Iongi was found guilty of manslaughter. All three were sentenced today.
Super Rugby Pacific: Blues seen as favourites against Fijian Drua by ‘excited’ young Northland fans https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/super-rugby-pacific-blues-seen-as-favourites-against-fijian-drua-by-excited-young-northland-fans/S3SGSDDAYNAVDMRUUE4DFL6X2I/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/super-rugby-pacific-blues-seen-as-favourites-against-fijian-drua-by-excited-young-northland-fans/S3SGSDDAYNAVDMRUUE4DFL6X2I/ Avneesh Vincent'I want to be like them and play rugby at the top level some day.' Fri, 23 Feb 2024 03:47:46 +0000 Young fans Harry Moore, 9, and Tohu Harding, 8, were excited to attend the Captain's Run for the Blues rugby team at Semenoff Stadium, Okara Park, Whangarei. Photo / Michael Cunningham
Auckland Transport stations security guards on Meola Rd to protect construction workers https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-transport-stations-security-guards-on-meola-rd-to-protect-construction-workers/OWGMIKTDRRB2LEUUSW5AUYY7U4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-transport-stations-security-guards-on-meola-rd-to-protect-construction-workers/OWGMIKTDRRB2LEUUSW5AUYY7U4/ The closure was recently extended for three more months until the end of April. Fri, 23 Feb 2024 03:43:14 +0000 Auckland Transport is putting security guards on Meola Road in the Auckland suburb of Pt Chevalier while roadworks continue. Photo / Nicola Lamb
Events in Waikato: Hamilton Arts Festival, outdoor movies part of event calendar https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/events-in-waikato-hamilton-arts-festival-outdoor-movies-part-of-event-calendar/BT3B4MOAIRFBBC4ZZMBM76IAKI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/events-in-waikato-hamilton-arts-festival-outdoor-movies-part-of-event-calendar/BT3B4MOAIRFBBC4ZZMBM76IAKI/ What's On in the Waikato in the next few weeks? Fri, 23 Feb 2024 03:42:24 +0000 The Sunset Symphony is of course part of the 2024 Hamilton Arts Festival combining orchestral music, whānau, friends, food and fireworks. Photo / Mark Hamilton
‘Mad cow’ disease restrictions on NZ blood donations to be lifted next week https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mad-cow-disease-restrictions-on-nz-blood-donations-to-be-lifted-next-week/G2MAROMF4BAMFCE67BA3CQOZHA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mad-cow-disease-restrictions-on-nz-blood-donations-to-be-lifted-next-week/G2MAROMF4BAMFCE67BA3CQOZHA/ After more than 20 years, the restriction will be removed on February 29. Fri, 23 Feb 2024 03:35:52 +0000 The "mad cow" blood donation restriction will be removed on February 29. Photo / 123RF
Meatstock Hamilton: Fireworks display removed from Mystery Creek event schedule https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/meatstock-hamilton-fireworks-display-removed-from-mystery-creek-event-schedule/GQ64YGYOSRBJTNQZVJ7CVM65VE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/meatstock-hamilton-fireworks-display-removed-from-mystery-creek-event-schedule/GQ64YGYOSRBJTNQZVJ7CVM65VE/ Fireworks may not be appropriate given the wider community's equestrian and rural nature. Fri, 23 Feb 2024 03:35:22 +0000 A planned fireworks display at Mystery Creek has been cancelled.
Dargaville gets its first Pizza Hut store https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/dargaville-gets-its-first-pizza-hut-store/6NVLTYGB55EF3F4XOS4NDYZLNM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/dargaville-gets-its-first-pizza-hut-store/6NVLTYGB55EF3F4XOS4NDYZLNM/On some nights due to demand they had run out of freshly made dough. Fri, 23 Feb 2024 03:29:18 +0000 Teenagers Ashton Kareko, 16 (left), and Jaydee Taurua, 17, think it is great that a Pizza Hut has opened in Dargaville. Photo / Rose Dixon
Tegan Ariel Chen, girl who died in Marian Creek, Fiordland ‘blazing a trail’ in heaven https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tegan-ariel-chen-girl-who-died-in-marian-creek-fiordland-blazing-a-trail-in-heaven/XM3BLCNJUBDZPENWPVEDW4RLLQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tegan-ariel-chen-girl-who-died-in-marian-creek-fiordland-blazing-a-trail-in-heaven/XM3BLCNJUBDZPENWPVEDW4RLLQ/ Melissa NightingaleTegan Chen died in late January after slipping from a rock into a fast-moving stream. Fri, 23 Feb 2024 03:00:00 +0000 Tegan Ariel Chen, 10, was on holiday with her family from New South Wales in late January 2024 when she fell into Marian Creek in Fiordland and died. Photo / Supplied
